concept_definition: Of the very darkest color, the result of the absence or complete absorption of visible light; having a color like that of coal or ink.
of the color of fresh snow or milk; reflecting nearly all visible light and having no hue
having the color of blood, fire, or ripe cherries; of a hue at the end of the visible spectrum (a primary color between orange and violet)
Having the color of the clear sky or the deep sea; a color between green and violet on the visible spectrum.
Of the color between blue and yellow in the visible spectrum; having the hue of fresh grass, leaves, or emeralds.
Having the color of ripe lemons, egg yolks, or sunflowers; of a hue between green and orange on the visible spectrum.
of a color produced by mixing red, yellow, and blue; a dark or muted shade between red and yellow; resembling the color of wood, soil, or hair
Of a color produced by mixing black and white; a neutral tone between black and white.
of a color between black and white
made of or colored like gold
